content:
Currently, I am a Postdoctoral Researcher with the Decision and Cognitive Sciences Research Centre, University of Manchester, Manchester, United Kingdom. My main research interests involve the study and design of data clustering techniques based on nature-inspired metaheuristics and their applications to problems from areas such as digital image segmentation and machine learning. Recently, I have been focused on the development of a multiobjective evolutionary approach for multi-view data clustering and its application to a range of application domains, ranging from network analysis to medical imaging data.
I received the B.Sc. degree in computer science from the Technological Institute of Culiacan in 2010, and the M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in computer science from the Center for Research and Advanced Studies of the National Polytechnic Institute (CINVESTAV-IPN), Mexico, in 2012 and 2017, respectively.
summary: Currently, I am a Postdoctoral Researcher with the Decision and Cognitive Sciences Research Centre, University of Manchester, Manchester, United Kingdom. My main research interests involve the study and design of data clustering techniques based on nature-inspired metaheuristics and their applications to problems from areas such as digital image segmentation and machine learning.

summary: This paper presents an up-to-date review of all major nature-inspired metaheuristic algorithms used thus far for automatic clustering.
title: Automatic clustering using nature-inspired metaheuristics: A survey

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math.
summary: This paper proposes an automatic method for TM construction based on learning rules. Our method considers the background knowledge of the RDBs during the building process and was implemented and applied on a representative set of 15 RDBs.
title: Rule‐based approach for topic maps learning from relational databases
